intro: Maieta pilosa, commonly known as the hairy maieta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Maieta pilosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
